question: Let <katex>$f:R\rightarrow R$</katex> be given <katex>$f(x)=tan~x.$</katex> Then <katex>$f^{-1}(1)$</katex> is
explanation: <katex>$f^{-1}(1)$</katex> represents the set of values <katex>$x$</katex> such that <katex>$\tan x = 1$</katex>.
The general solution for <katex>$\tan x = 1$</katex> is <katex>$x = n\pi + \frac{\pi}{4}$</katex> where <katex>$n \in Z$</katex>.
